hillbillies.util

Class ConnectedToBorder

  • java.lang.Object
    • hillbillies.util.ConnectedToBorder

  • public class ConnectedToBorder
extends java.lang.Object
    Interface for a (somewhat efficient) algorithm that determines whether a solid cube is connected to a border of the world through other directly adjacent solid cubes. The algorithm assumes two things: (1) initially, the entire world is solid; (2) a cube can only transition from solid to passable. USAGE: Create ONE instance of ConnectedToBorder for a world, initialized with the dimensions of the world. Initially, the world is assumed to be completely composed of SOLID tiles. Update the algorithm state using the changeSolidToPassable(int, int, int) method. At any point, use the isSolidConnectedToBorder(int, int, int) method to find out if a cube is connected to the world.
    Author:
    Koen Yskout
    Note:
    The problem to solve is an instance of the 'decremental dynamic connectivity' graph problem; better algorithms probably exist.

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      ConnectedToBorder(int nbX, int nbY, int nbZ)
      Create a new instance of the algorithm, initialized for a world of the given dimensions where all cubes are solid.

    • Method Detail

      • isSolidConnectedToBorder

        public boolean isSolidConnectedToBorder(int x,
                                        int y,
                                        int z)
        Returns whether the cube at the given position is a solid cube that is connected to a border of the world through other directly adjacent solid cubes.
        Parameters:
        x - The x-coordinate of the cube to test
        y - The y-coordinate of the cube to test
        z - The z-coordinate of the cube to test
        Returns:
        true if the cube is connected; false otherwise
        Note:
        The result is pre-computed, so this query returns immediately.

      • changePassableToSolid

        public java.util.List<int[]> changePassableToSolid(int x,
                                                   int y,
                                                   int z)
        Make the cube at the given position solid instead of passable, and return the list of coordinates that became connected to a border of the world due to this change.
        Parameters:
        x - The x-coordinate of the cube to make solid
        y - The y-coordinate of the cube to make solid
        z - The z-coordinate of the cube to make solid
        Returns:
        The list of cube coordinates (where each coordinate is an array {x, y, z}) that have become connected to the border by performing this change. If non-empty, this always includes the provided coordinate itself.
        Note:
        This operation possibly iterates over the whole world, so it could take some time.

      • changeSolidToPassable

        public java.util.List<int[]> changeSolidToPassable(int x,
                                                   int y,
                                                   int z)
        Make the cube at the given position passable instead of solid, and return the list of coordinates that are no longer connected to a border of the world due to this change.
        Parameters:
        x - The x-coordinate of the cube to make passable
        y - The y-coordinate of the cube to make passable
        z - The z-coordinate of the cube to make passable
        Returns:
        The list of cube coordinates (where each coordinate is an array {x, y, z}) that have become disconnected from the border by performing this change.
        Note:
        This operation possibly iterates over the whole world, so it could take some time.
